column4: In feisty, do i have to reinstall any drivers and stuff if I am compiling a custom kernel?
last time i compiled my own kernel, couple years ago, modules was compiled and installed with commands "make modules" and "make modules install"

I do need to. I need some adsl modem driver to be installed. It requires that I get the kernel source and boot from the kernel.  and i am not sure whether I should use the ueagle driver provided in the kernel
i bet the way kernel is compiled nowadays is easier...
